column4: anyways i was wondering if you or someone else here could help me with a situation i have
you see, i lost xp with a bad hdd, got a new hdd, installed ubuntu (lost xp key), and now i found it im upgradeing to vista, how would i go about installing vista
i want to duel boot
why another hdd?
i cant get another hdd
i want to duel boot on same hdd
it's a big hdd
i cant partition? ive seen people talking about 2oses on 1 hdd
how would i go about setting up grub?
grub install
i dont liek to say it, but Vista (or windows) doesnt really want you to dualboot, so you'll lose grub anyway. What is your partition lay out now?
so you have a ext3 (ubuntu) partition and a swap partition?
install gparted from the repo's, and create a new NTFS partition with it.
then install Vista on that partition, it will remove grub, since Vista uses his own boot record, but dont worry, you can recover grub, and add Vista to it
on the internet you can find a lot of ways to recover grub

as far as i know, if you reinstall grub on your ubuntu partition, it will automaticly add ubuntu, and also vista, but im not sure of that last one, but you can manually add to the grub's menu.lst, but you have to install grub before you can do that
yep, but im not 100% sure it adds it automaticly, ive never installed windows after ubuntu, i only installed ubuntu and removed windows :D
ok, good luck!
or if you are more experienced with linux, you can partition with the alternate cd too, but it is more complicated then doing it with the live cd
with installer i meant gparted in the system menu...it is early :)
the live CD is on of the best things, and can help you in a lot of situations
